This is the official thing called single value, https://github.com/apache/skywalking-query-protocol/blob/42d6783d8c1a0d0d4c2b28e58dc1f47dd554964e/metrics-v2.graphqls#L143-L144. 

Also as the option on the UI setting page.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5441976/111464608-f0672f80-875b-11eb-9681-6bbfbdb81ff6.png)

If you are asking about the label, then, it is totally different thing. https://github.com/apache/skywalking-query-protocol/blob/42d6783d8c1a0d0d4c2b28e58dc1f47dd554964e/metrics-v2.graphqls#L149-L151

Both of them could visualize the way you mentioned, please confirm the case.
OK, I got it. I mean labeled value, and need a more directly Chart to show the info like `read the single value in the duration `, not just `Line/Area/Bar`

There are 2 ways
1. Don't focus on the version match mechanism. You could intercept the new construct directly. But as you are sharing the same target class, you need to change the old `HTableInstrumentation` and add a `ConstructorInterceptPoint`. Then, the plugin should be renamed to `hbase-1.x-2.x-plugin`.(documents should be updated too)
2. If you insist to use version match mechanism to create a new plugin called `hbase-2.x-plugin`, then, read `Set up witnessClasses and/or witnessMethods if the instrumentation should be activated in specific versions.` section in the plug dev doc, https://skywalking.apache.org/docs/main/v8.4.0/en/guides/java-plugin-development-guide/. You need to find special class or method to identify the version in the runtime.

Actually, let me be clear about what you want to the UI side. @Fine0830 ignore above discussion to avoid confusing.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5441976/111466279-0c6bd080-875e-11eb-8a38-0a36dc721190.png)

We need to add another new option, called `Table of latest values`, which means, you still use the same query, but show the result as a table with 2 columns. Col-1 is the label name, col-2 is the latest value of the label. The latest value is the value in the last time slot.

Q1, it depends
1. Whether the node showing on the topology?
2. Whether the server has installed an agent?
If both are YES, then the IP:port most likely is in the `network_address_alias`. The topology includes the logic name once the mapping/alias detected by OAP.

Q2, you need to apply for an ID for the new component, https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/master/oap-server/server-bootstrap/src/main/resources/component-libraries.yml. Then use this component id in the new plugin. Then you could add the icon by using the name, like this, https://github.com/apache/skywalking-rocketbot-ui/pull/419/files
Got it
Report OAP agent? Could you provide a little more details about how it helps? And how the agent will use it if there is a version.
@wu-sheng This is just my consideration based on imagination. If we have a breaking endpoint change of data collect protocol, an agent will want to switch them. Do we have these situations?

> @wu-sheng This is just my consideration based on imagination. If we have a breaking endpoint change of data collect protocol, an agent will want to switch them. Do we have these situations?

2 background stories are, SkyWalking as a tracer server, our ecosystem is set up very slowly. So, the protocol is nearly never changed. v3(we are using) is set up in 2020, v2 was in 2017.
Even, we need to change something, we expect to add a new field, rather than a break.
At last, we have to, we will change service name(v2->v3), or like you asked us to add `v3` in the namespace. So you could check GRPC's `unimplemented service` error.
Sure. maybe we don't have this right now.

> 1. the plugin should be renamed to `hbase-1.x-2.x-plugin`

I prefer the first one since the`HTable` public methods still have no change, I think HBase Client Core API won't change often.
And if we need to change the plugin name, why not just name it `hbase-plugin` directly?

Maybe `hbase-1.x-2.x-plugin` will be more clearly, like `tomcat-7.x-8.x-plugin`. 
After renaming the plugin, just use 2.x dependency in the pom.xml? No 1.x dependency anymore, but the plugin still suits 1.x.

> Maybe `hbase-1.x-2.x-plugin` will be more clearly, like `tomcat-7.x-8.x-plugin`.
> After renaming the plugin, just use 2.x dependency in the pom.xml? No 1.x dependency anymore, but the plugin still suits 1.x.

Compiling dependency doesn't matter. Remember to add 2.0 into plugin tests(e2e). We need them to verify.
@nisiyong You actually need another issue to describe the issue. This issue actually is related to ElasticSearch client plugin somehow.
I am going to close this discussion for now. Let's see whether there is a new case.

For Q1 : 
Neo4j node is not showing up in topology. There is no agent installed on neo4j server as well. 

But Postgres and RabbitMQ nodes are present in topology which are auto detected (no agent installed there as well).  So if Service is communicating with Neo4j IP than the Neo4j node should also be displayed and stored in instance client/server tables?

Kindly advice. 

Thanks and Regards,
Jayesh Muley

> For Q1 :
> Neo4j node is not showing up in topology. There is no agent installed on neo4j server as well.
> 
> But Postgres and RabbitMQ nodes are present in topology which are auto detected (no agent installed there as well). So if Service is communicating with Neo4j IP than the Neo4j node should also be displayed and stored in instance client/server tables?
> 
> Kindly advice.
> 
> Thanks and Regards,
> Jayesh Muley

Then, it is most likely, you need a plugin for Neo4j client library. That is how the other servers work.
Okay, I will do it tomorrow.

(1) After you read the source codes, you will notice, there is a combination/merge operation between memory and database. If read the dirty data in the next round, the update would not be accurate. Performance is a thing having a lower priority than accuracy. Otherwise, there is pointless.
(2) I don't agree with you. `refresh_interval` only relates to the record-type data, mostly traces, and logs. (1) is about metrics.

> Set up a new backend, and everything should be back to normal in several minute. You could upgrade agents on any moment you can.

Hello. Is the upgrade from 8.1 to 8.4 similar to the upgrade from 8.3 to 8.4?

> Read plugin development doc, one step is missing. We need the plugin e2e test.

OK
Capture and continue have nothing related to tags. They link 2 spans as parent and child only

Ok thanks.

In that case, from the child, how can I get access to the parent span?

Thanks in advance

You can configure the alarm rules with dynamic configuration, for many popular configuration centers, there are web UI to configure the yaml, but if you're asking for non-yaml edit of the configuration, we don't have that

> In that case, from the child, how can I get access to the parent span?

No, you can't. Tracing is not for propagating the business context. Are you asking for some other use cases?

@zhaoyuguang Could you share what is progress happens on the Seata side? This thing began and failed. In the previous discussion, we agree that we should have a plugin, and integrated agent+plugin on the Seata side(source codes and distribution).

I think the doc is very clear about what could and couldn't trace. 
https://github.com/apache/skywalking-nodejs#supported-libraries
The contribution is welcome, please read the doc before submitting an issue.

> @zhaoyuguang Could you share what is progress happens on the Seata side? This thing began and failed. In the previous discussion, we agree that we should have a plugin, and integrated agent+plugin on the Seata side(source codes and distribution).

The old version of Seata did not have a transfer protocol similar to HTTP header, and it was easy to be incompatible when the client and server did not have probes together. After my communication with @slievrly, Seata now has a good header protocol in 1.4.x in not batch-mode.

> > @zhaoyuguang Could you share what is progress happens on the Seata side? This thing began and failed. In the previous discussion, we agree that we should have a plugin, and integrated agent+plugin on the Seata side(source codes and distribution).
> 
> The old version of Seata did not have a transfer protocol similar to HTTP header, and it was easy to be incompatible when the client and server did not have probes together. After my communication with @slievrly, Seata now has a good header protocol in 1.4.x in batch-mode.

This is good, and that was why @kezhenxu94 gave up. But even we have that, still we need Seata server-side plugin and installed agent to propagate the tracing context. From the previous discussion, those plugins should be hosted in the Seata repo.

Such as, in Apache DolphinScheduler's next release branch, https://github.com/apache/incubator-dolphinscheduler/tree/1.3.6-prepare/ext/skywalking. They have `ext/skywalking` folder for source codes. And their distribution includes our agent and necessary plugins.

Our existing plugin tests are here, https://github.com/apache/skywalking/tree/master/test/plugin/scenarios/play-scenario, including the 2.8. Maybe you used the framework in another way. Please recheck the test codes and compare them to yours.

@wu-sheng 

I use the rate function to represent the trend in number per second.

I use the increase function to represent the increments per minute.

For example, let's assume that there are two persistence_timer_bulk_prepare operations between 09: 59 and 10: 00, which take 20 seconds and 10 seconds respectively. Then, it took 2 minutes to do next persistence_timer_bulk_prepare operation.

This panel should look like this: 

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/28091237/111856910-fa11b280-8968-11eb-8185-d00bccb9d005.png)

This may be difficult to understand at first. It works better when you get used to it. It can help us to intuitively see some high-latency single operation. In order to optimize it.

You can see this in the configuration file.

      - name: "FileAppender"
        fileName: "${logPath}${filename}"

        PatternLayout:
          pattern: "${pattern}"
        Policies:
          TimeBasedTriggeringPolicy: {}
        immediateFlush: false
      - name: "AnalysisFileAppender"
        fileName: "${logPath}analysis-${filename}"
        filePattern: "${logPath}analysis-${filename}.%d{yyyy-MM-dd}"
        PatternLayout:
          pattern: "${pattern}"
        Policies:
          TimeBasedTriggeringPolicy: {}
        immediateFlush: false
      - name: "HTTPRequestFileAppender"
        fileName: "${logPath}http-request-${filename}"
        filePattern: "${logPath}http-request-${filename}.%d{yyyy-MM-dd}"
        PatternLayout:
          pattern: "${httpRequestPattern}"
        Policies:
          TimeBasedTriggeringPolicy: {}
        immediateFlush: false
      - name: "RPCRequestFileAppender"
        fileName: "${logPath}rpc-request-${filename}"
        filePattern: "${logPath}rpc-request-${filename}.%d{yyyy-MM-dd}"
        PatternLayout:
          pattern: "${pattern}"
        Policies:
          TimeBasedTriggeringPolicy: {}
        immediateFlush: false
    Async:
      - name: "AsyncFileAppender"
        AppenderRef:
          - ref: FileAppender
        bufferSize: 10000
      - name: "AsyncAnalysisFileAppender"
        AppenderRef:
          - ref: AnalysisFileAppender
        bufferSize: 15000
      - name: "AsyncHTTPRequestFileAppender"
        AppenderRef:
          - ref: HTTPRequestFileAppender
        bufferSize: 10000
      - name: "AsyncRPCRequestFileAppender"
        AppenderRef:
          - ref: RPCRequestFileAppender
        bufferSize: 10000

  Loggers:
    AsyncLogger:
      - name: "RequestLogger"
        level: info
        additivity: false
        AppenderRef:
          - ref: AsyncHTTPRequestFileAppender
      - name: "RpcRequestLogger"
        level: info
        additivity: false
        AppenderRef:
          - ref: AsyncRPCRequestFileAppender
      - name: "AnalysisLogger"
        level: info
        additivity: false
        AppenderRef:
          - ref: AsyncAnalysisFileAppender
    AsyncRoot:
      level: info
      AppenderRef:
        - ref: AsyncFileAppender

```
